name: CONMAP
short_description:
CONMAP is a console program to aid in geobody connection analysis in geosciences.  It accepts input and outpts results in GEO-EAS (GSLIB) format for easy interoperability with most geoscience softwares.

To get help in usage, simply run the program without arguments.

CONMAP is a Java 1.7 program.  Open a command prompt, go to the directory where you download CONMAP.jar and enter the command "java -jar CONMAP.jar <arguments>" (without quotation marks) to run the program.

Geobody detection itself runs pretty fast, with almost all execution time spent in file loading, parsing and saving.

New features in version 2.0:
geobody walk, vertical transitions count and mean thickness.  See details running CONMAP without arguments.
summary: Geobody connectivity analysis tool in geosciences.  New version: 2.0
